content: SUNY Center of Excellence in Health Disparities
How the Center Works
Administrative Core – under this core, Upstate and Downstate will:
dot-list
Oversee Upstate and Downstate Coordinating Hubs for faculty and researchers in their respective regions
Appoint leaders to oversee the Center’s other cores
Create a Board of Advisors to provide insights and recommendations on how UAlbany and SUNY Downstate can better manage the Center.
Research Infrastructure Core – under this core, the partners will establish:
dot-list
A Network of Research Affiliates of SUNY scholars and other public and private institutions of higher education who would like to become a member of the Center.
A Library of Researcher Profiles to enhance faculty and scholarly collaboration.
A Seed-Funding Program to encourage both faculty research collaboration and to promote pilot studies and data/findings with the goal of enhancing competitiveness for extramural funding.
Faculty and Grants Development Core – under this core, the partners will establish:
dot-list
Proposal Writing Training and Support to enhance the competitiveness of faculty in competing for extramural funding
Community Engagement Core – given the critical importance of community engaged research, the partners will:
dot-list
Develop a Roadmap of Regional Community-based Organizations in order to ensure that community partners are both identified and engaged
Host a National Conference in 2021 for up to 500-600 participants
Dissemination Core – during the life of the research, the partners will:
dot-list

Publication, Conferences, Networks –the partner will broadly disseminate the Centers’ research data, findings and products through publications, conference presentations, and government and public health networks, among other pathways.
A SUNY-led Health Disparities Journal will be established for faculty and researchers to present new research journal publications and findings.
